list_definition.definition: a thin tube that is put into your body in order to remove a liquid such as blood or urine

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They used a catheter to drain the urine from his bladder.

list_ex_of_english: When labour begins, the patient should be monitored carefully using electrocardiographic, arterial, and epidural catheters.
The catheters are much simpler and less costly.
Figure 1 presents original chart recordings and compares rapid inflation of the balloon catheter with progressive inflation.
Pressure measurements and angiograms were repeated after implantation and all catheters removed.
The patient is imaged and planned and the catheters attached to the afterloader.
The catheter was removed and the guide-wire was left in the distal vessel.
The diameters of the vessels were measured and corrected for magnification with reference to a catheter of known size.
A catheter is introduced via the femoral artery and directed into the target vessel under image control.
